notes.name: battery-report
notes.text:
To get the full battery report of your device: 
1.go to run and open cmd.
2.type "powercfg/batteryreport" and press enter.
3.check the user folder for the .html file and open in browser

Done :)

notes.name: battery-wear
notes.text:
ðŸ’¡Battery wear is common in all laptops , and it is a scientific phenomenon of a battery lifecycle.So if laptop is on 6% wear level, then your battery is capable of only 94% charge (but still OS will show you 100% ) 

ðŸ”‹How to check the battery wear level?
directly use Hwinfo.exe / use windows cmd method (both are in notes)

Also the software values for wear level can't be fully trusted, That battery wear level is actually software based , so theres no pure hardware level evidence of how much the battery is the battery wear..



ðŸ”‹ðŸ”ŒHow to avoid/decrease battery wear?
Plug in charger everytime you use Laptop., Whenever possible. 
That will not use the battery cycles , and hence the battery life is conserved.

ðŸ’°Don't care about always pluggin in  , it wont cost you electricity bill, as the  laptop takes power from adapter as much as it needs....nothing more.

notes.name: hinge
notes.text:
ðŸ’» For a better hinge life, Always open laptop lid from center , nowadays as screens are more bezel lesss , they are more delicate and fit into the thin frame ,so they should be handled with care as well ,
.


ðŸ–¥ Also if you always open lid the wrong way , it may result in increased screen bleeding over time.
.

ðŸ’» Try not to open the hinge frequently.(One finger lift hinges get more loose after prolonged opening/closing) if you want your laptop to last longer 
.


ðŸ§¨or if you have a lot of money ,and you can buy a new laptop every year, then you can definitely act your wish! ;)

notes.name: ms-office
notes.text:
(please turn off windows defender before installation)
1. Download ms office from here: https://getintopc.com/softwares/office-tools/microsoft-office-2019-professional-plus-updated-apr-2020-download-1274708/ 

2. Install like regular office. 

3. run #msoffice-activation here ,  and download that file.
   
activation part in next command: /get msoffice-activation

notes.name: msoffice-activation
notes.text:
4.  Save this file on desktop with .bat extension.
(make sure that after saving the file  the icon is changed from notepad icon to settings icon, if the icon do not change , copy the code inside it and paste it in another file ,  and try to save it again with .bat extension) ex: xyz.bat

5. NOw right click that file and select  run as administrator .
if your office version is incompatible , try restarting pc and try again ...

notes.name: new_laptop
notes.text:
New Laptop? check important things first!

PERFORMANCE:
install -> check the scores with similar machines.
1.Cinebench r20 : 
2.Geekbench:
3.HWinfo:

=======================================================
HARDWARE: (Hynix  , crucial , WD , toshiba,  seagate and standard disk drives)
1.check RAM stick and its frequency : 
2.Check SSD , HDD brand and Their R/W speeds:

=======================================================

DISPLAY:  (most probably AU optronics)
1.Check display model:  
2.Check screen bleeding (it is normal in IPS displays, just dont let it be beyond limits)
3. Check Dead Pixels. if found , then replace (amazon/flipkart) , acer will not consider dead pixel , unless they are more than 4-5. (sub pixels)

=======================================================

THERMALS:
Install some games and check if temperature rises suddenly or take a look on nitro/predator sense if available.
(most probably new laptop has perfect thermals due to new thermal paste)

notes.name: sabko_sach_bata_do
notes.text: TO BE HONEST: WE ALWAYS CHECK VERY MINUTE THINGS AFTER BUYING LAPTOP , LIKE DEAD PIXELS , SCREEN BLEEDING , AND RGB , BUT AFTER 1 OR 2 MONTHS THERE COMES A POINT WHERE WE NEVER NOTICE SUCH THINGS IN EVERYDAY LIFE .. FOR EXAMPLE MY DISPLAY HAD A DEAD PIXEL , BUT NOW I DONT EVEN REMEMBER WHERE IT IS , NEITHER I HAVE TIME TO TURN OFF ALL LIGHTS AND FIND IT WITH FULL BRIGHTNESS. NEITHER SCREEN BLEED IS VISIBLE (thanks to 6sec boot time) , ITS JUST THAT WE PUT SO MUCH EFFORTS ON THINGS WHICH REALLY DONT MATTER IN LONG TERM..........SO TAKE A CHILL PILL , UNLESS ACER GAVE YOU An *INTEL PENTIUM* CHIP INSTEAD OF *RYZEN7 4800H* .......ðŸ˜‰

notes.name: screenbleeding
notes.text:
Lcd stands for Liquid crystal Display,
 so it's just small thin sheets with gel in them...so when you press , move or bend it, color changes.

And that's the property of LCD screens.

Thats the main cause of screen bleeding 
.
.
Screen bleeding is not a damage.
Its just the place where screen is too tight with the lid body
(You wont find bleeding in Oled panels as it has individual pixels rather than liquid film)

notes.name: slow-restart
notes.text:
slow-restart slow restart is  not problem specific to nitro5....it is a part of windows and how it handles boot.
In windows 10 when we shut down, system does not close all services and totally shut down, but it directly saves raw data in ssd,(just like hibernate) so next time when we boot , it takes only 5-10 seconds. 
But when you restart , system clears all memory and closes all apps and reloads whole OS and drivers  again freshly , so it takes more time to restart. :), and this is the reason windows asks you to restart  after any update or installation .ðŸ˜ƒ

notes.name: windows-activation
notes.text:
To activate any windows:
(please turn off windows defender before this)
1. go to : bit.ly/windowstxt
2. Copy all code and paste in notepad.
3. Save the text file on desktop ,with extension ".cmd" .and make sure the icon changes after saving (as shown in image).
4. Run the file as administrator.

//Done! ;)
